name: magnetite production | magnetite | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/972/documentation

This dataset represents the production of 1 kg of magnetite for the use as magnetic carrier in toner for printer applications. This dataset is established on stoichiometric estimations and should not be used in cases where magnetite contributes significantly to the total mass of an inventory.

The activity starts when the raw materials enter the process.

This activity ends with the production of magnetite. The dataset includes the basic raw materials consumed and energy for precipitation reaction, filtration and drying. No direct emissions and no specific infrastructure are included.
category: C:Manufacturing/20:Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products/202:Manufacture of other chemical products/2022:Manufacture of paints, varnishes and similar coatings, printing ink and mas

processDocumentation.technologyDescription: This dataset represents the most common production process.

exchanges.description: Magnetite is a (brownish-)black ferrimagnetic mineral. Being the most magnetic of the naturally-occuring minerals, it is both attracted to magnets and can be magentized to function as a permanent magnet by itself. It appears as one of the main iron ores. Magnetite can be applied as magnetic carrier in toner for printer applications.
